sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The maiden queene entituled the Britaine shepheardes teares for the death of Astrabomica Augmented the worldes vanitie. Both in sententiall verse, necessary and profitable to bee read of all men. 1607. Raymonde, Henry.
[62] p. : ill. (woodcut)
By I[ohn] W[indet] for Iohn Browne and are to be sold at his shop in Saint Dunstons Churchyard in Fleetstreet, Imprinted at London : [1607]
Dedication signed: Henry Raymonde. In verse. Signatures: A-H⁴ (-H4). "The vvorldes vanitie" has divisional title page; register is continuous. Reproduction of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
